Text saved: Graffiti, which is drawing or writing on walls in public places, and street art, which is any artwork created outside museums, are now being discussed by the art world. Recently, the art world has started to see more value in these forms, and this growing recognition has led to major exhibitions in galleries in Paris, London and Los Angeles. In 2008 the American artist Elura Emerald organised a street‑art show at a New York gallery. She defended street artists by saying that artists who paint on the street are just expressing themselves, not hurting anyone, so they should be appreciated and celebrated.
